messages.title: The best choice for Gordon
messages.content: Campaigning to keep the Number 5 bus link between Dufford, Danestone and Aberdeen Royal Infirmary and the city centre. Fighting for the Post Office service Gordon deserves.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Fairer taxes that put money back in your pocket; Nick Clegg's tax plan means you will pay no tax on the first £10,000 you earn – cutting most tax bills by £700.
A fair chance for every child; The Lib Dems would give more cash for schools to recruit more teachers, smaller class sizes and one-to-one tuition.
A fair future: creating jobs by making the UK greener; A Lib Dem government would invest in public transport, renewable energy and energy-efficient homes.
A fair deal for you from the politicians; We would make politicians accountable and give you the right to sack corrupt MPs.

mentions.tacticalSituation: With the Conservatives and Labour out of the race, the choice here is between Malcolm Bruce and the SNP candidate.

issues.health: Launching the campaign for a new health centre for Ellon.

leaflet.personalStatement: Having raised a young family here, I know just how important good schools, health care and transport links are. Ensuring that these get the investment that they need is crucial to securing local jobs.

contactInformation.address: John Russell, 7 Mathers Place, Newburgh, Ellon, AB41 6DT

endorsements.endorser: Independent/PoliticsHome largest representative UK poll, Autumn 2009
endorsements.endorsement: Liberal Democrat MPs were more highly regarded by their constituents than Conservative or Labour were by theirs.

quotes.text: Liberal Democrat MPs were more highly regarded by their constituents than Conservative or Labour were by theirs.
quotes.source: Independent/PoliticsHome largest representative UK poll, Autumn 2009

images.caption: Malcolm Bruce with constituents and supporting local services.
